sentence.Network_cn: 我不愿意牵涉在欺诈行为里.

sentence.Network_cn: 她引诱帕科一起合谋来骗取塔妮娅的积蓄。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: back-formation from swindler, from German Schwindler 'extravagant maker of schemes, swindler', from schwindeln 'be giddy', also 'tell lies'

entry.tran: 诈骗,骗取，欺诈(尤指钱财)
entry.def: If someone swindles a person or an organization, they deceive them in order to get something valuable from them, especially money.

example.ex: A City businessman swindled investors out of millions of pounds...
example.tran: 一名来自伦敦商业区的商人骗取了投资者们数百万英镑。

example.ex: An oil executive swindled £50,000 out of his firm.
example.tran: 一名石油公司主管从其公司骗取了 5 万英镑。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of swindling by some fraudulent scheme;

sentences.sentence: "He swindled me out of my inheritance"
"She defrauded the customers who trusted her"
"the cashier gypped me when he gave me too little change"

sentences.en: He swindled us out of a lot of money.
She swindled him out of his life savings.
